thread.title: Bridging Cultures, Science, and Friendship: UNHAS-KU Summer Program 2025 Officially Concludes in Bulukumba
thread.title_full: Bridging Cultures, Science, and Friendship: UNHAS-KU Summer Program 2025 Officially Concludes in Bulukumba

author: @antaramakassar
title: Bridging Cultures, Science, and Friendship: UNHAS-KU Summer Program 2025 Officially Concludes in Bulukumba
text:
Makassar (ANTARA) - After being held from 31 August to 12 September 2025, the Hasanuddin University - Kanazawa University (UNHAS-KU) Summer Program 2025 officially concluded with a warm closing ceremony at Same Resort, Bulukumba.
This year marked the first implementation of the program, involving 20 participants from 7 countries. The participants consisted of 8 students from Kanazawa University, Japan, and 12 students from UNHAS, including both local and international students. The international participants represented Afghanistan, Nigeria, Sudan, Tanzania, and Yemen, showcasing the truly global spirit of the program.
The closing ceremony was officially led by the Head of the International Office of UNHAS, Andi Masyitha Irwan, S.Kep., Ns., MAN., Ph.D. In her remarks, she expressed hope that this program would not only bring benefits to all participants but also serve as a pioneer for future collaboration between UNHAS and KU in the field of summer programs.
The agenda also featured short reflections from participant representatives: Aoi Kimoto from KU and Said Sadallah Said from Tanzania, UNHAS. Both shared their gratitude and memorable experiences during the program, emphasising the importance of cross-cultural understanding, collaboration, and friendship.
To close the evening, all participants joined in a karaoke session while enjoying traditional Sarabba (a traditional spiced ginger drink from South Sulawesi) and fried banana and cassava, leaving behind laughter and cherished memories.
Following the conclusion, the participants will return to Makassar, while students from Kanazawa University will directly proceed to Sultan Hasanuddin International Airport for their departure.
